answers.answer: Hello,Frequent urination in adults can be due to many causes. The primary cause which needs to be excluded is diabetes. I would advise you to get a fasting blood sugar and Hb A1 C test done.If diabetes is ruled out then other possibilities which need to be ruled out are pregnancy, interstitial cystitis, overactive bladder syndrome neurological diseases, urinary incontinence, bladder cancer(rare) and bladder dysfunction .I sincerely hope that helps. Take care.

question: I am a generally healthy 20 year old female.  For about five months now, I have had sudden episodes where I suddenly need to urinate instantly and frequently.  My urine is colorless and odorless during these episodes (normally it is an obvious shade of yellow).  There is no pain when I urinate.  The frequency ranges from every fifteen minutes to about an hour.  These can last for an hour for up to 4 days long.  Putting up with this is getting exhausting.  I've been checked for a UTI, but nothing came up positive (although there was apparently trace amounts of blood in my urine).  Sometimes, my lower abdomen feels swollen and heavy, like it is pressing on my bladder. Just as suddenly as it shows up, it goes away.  Any ideas?
title: Sudden Urinary Frequency
